unnormalised: ## The Great Escape: Why Your Cart Looks Like a Crowded Dadar Station Platform
normalised: Okay, picture this: You are finally browsing your favorite e-commerce site, after a long day haggling with the auto-wallah near your house. You have found the perfect Kanjeevaram saree for your cousin's wedding in Chennai, a swanky new Bluetooth speaker that will blast Bollywood tunes during Diwali, and enough packets of Haldiram's Bhujia to feed the entire colony. You add everything to your cart, feeling like Ambani himself.

normalised: Then... poof. You vanish. The cart sits there, abandoned, looking lonelier than Rahul Gandhi at a B J P rally.

unnormalised: Then... *poof*. You vanish. The cart sits there, abandoned, looking lonelier than Rahul Gandhi at a BJP rally.
normalised: Why, oh why, do we do this? Why do we fill our virtual shopping carts like they are overflowing thaalis at an Onam Sadhya, only to leave it all behind like that one unattended bag at a crowded railway station?

unnormalised: Why, oh why, do we do this? Why do we fill our virtual shopping carts like they're overflowing thaalis at an Onam Sadhya, only to leave it all behind like that one unattended bag at a crowded railway station?
normalised: Well, chances are, something spooked you. Maybe the shipping costs suddenly jumped higher than Mount Everest. Maybe you realized your bank account balance looks more like a cricket score than a respectable number (especially after that impulsive biryani order last night). Or maybe your Auntie Meena called demanding you explain why you haven’t found a suitable match yet, and you completely forgot about your online shopping spree.

normalised: The good news? Retailers are fighting back! Expect to see reminder emails popping up in your inbox, whispering sweet nothings about discounts and free shipping (like your mom bribing you with gulab jamun to finish your homework). So, next time you are tempted to abandon your cart, think twice. That perfect saree might just be waiting for you with a little extra love (and maybe a coupon code!). After all, who can say no to a good bargain, especially when it involves a delicious Kanjeevaram?
